definition: according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy

sentences.english: So let’s look at the evidence.
sentences.chinese: 那么让我们看看真凭实据。

sentences.english: The essential goal is to uncover substantive, factual material that affirms your argument.
sentences.chinese: 研究目的在于找出真凭实据以支持你的论点。

sentences.english: Patents he claimed to have filed did not exist.
sentences.chinese: 他自称拥有的多项专利均查无实据。

sentences.english: You'll need real proof to convince him.
sentences.chinese: 你要说服他要有真凭实据。

sentences.english: One must be sure of one's facts before making a public accusation.
sentences.chinese: 要先掌握实据才可以进行公开指责。

sentences.english: Evidentiality performs interpersonal functions in language use.
sentences.chinese: 实据性体现了语言的人际功能。

sentences.english: I knew we had no real offense to hang on him.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我们没有掌握他什么犯罪的真凭实据来制服他。

sentences.english: Gather enough facts so you can qualify the opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 要搜集到足够的实据，这样才能够评估机会的好坏。

sentences.english: I have no evidence but moral evidence to bring forward.
sentences.chinese: 我没有真凭实据，只有提出道义上的证据。

sentences.english: The choices of evidentials are determined by the reporters' communicative intention.
sentences.chinese: 实据性的选择与新闻传播的目的息息相关。

sentences.english: We cannot condemn him without factual evidence.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能在没有真凭实据的情况下就认为他有罪。

definition: bad record (esp. of a public official)/unsavory track record
one side of the story/one-sided statement
to turn out to be true/verified/true
lit. without wind there cannot be waves (idiom); there must be a reason/no smoke without fire
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to abuse one's position for personal gain (idiom)
